name: Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies
author: Chef John
summary: These classic cookies don't get much easier.
directions: Beat butter, white sugar, brown sugar, peanut butter, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a stand mixer until smooth
Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beater with a spatula
Add egg and mix for about 1 minute
Slowly mix in flour with the mixer on low
Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beater
Mix on medium until combined, about 30 seconds
Form dough into a ball, cover with plastic and refrigerate for 2-3 hours
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Portion out cookie dough in equal-sized balls on a baking sheet covered with a silicone baking mat
Use damp hands to roll dough into smooth balls
Stamp each ball with a fork in a criss-cross pattern
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes until golden
Leave on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack
